pages.text: Plundering through old architectures, you've came across a sort of blueprint for a powerful Golem that's used for wars in ancient days. The Golem seems mighty, though it requires a mold made of Diamonds and Stone Bricks to create such a terrible beast.
Right click the center Redstone Block with an Animation Core.

The Stone Bricks can be substituted with other similar blocks such as Deepslate Bricks. The resulting Golem proves far superior to the Iron Golems as not only is it stronger, but it can be commanded to follow, wander or stay in position through a wand/staff. They can be repaired by right-clicking on them with Redstone Dusts or Blocks.

Should the Golem fell from battle or command, they will drop their 'skull'. The Skull can be used to revive the Golem in a cheaper manner. However, the Skull remembers it's original creator and master and the revived Golem will only follow their commands.
